messages.msgSnippet: ... I have to say I m *really* pleased that my son is growing his hair.  But I certainly haven t told *him* that.    And I never said anything about not
messages.messageBody:
>
>
>Ugly: That his own father 'likes his hair long' and wants him to grow
>it back instead of getting a 'buzz' cut like the kid wants.

I have to say I'm *really* pleased that my son is growing his hair. But I
certainly haven't told *him* that. <g> And I never said anything about
not liking it short.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke

On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Another Good, Bad and Ugly
messages.msgSnippet: Good: That my soon to be 6yo son took it upon himself to cut his hair because it was too long for him and bothered him. I see it as a sign that he is coming
messages.messageBody:
Good: That my soon to be 6yo son took it upon himself to cut his hair
because it was too long for him and bothered him. I see it as a sign
that he is 'coming into himself and his own awareness thereof'. He
did it carefully and made sure he didn't make a mess.

Bad: The way people respond with slight looks of horror when they see
him, ask me about the huge chunks of hair missing in the front, and I
say very happily that he cut his hair, and he likes the way it looks.

Ugly: That his own father 'likes his hair long' and wants him to grow
it back instead of getting a 'buzz' cut like the kid wants.
